snippet: A number of states, including North Carolina, Maryland, Massachusetts, New York and Connecticut, are working to build a case for suing the nation's largest banks in connection with the recent rate-rigging scandal involving the London interbank...
abstract: A number of states, including North Carolina, Maryland, Massachusetts, New York and Connecticut, are working to build a case for suing the nation's largest banks in connection with the recent rate-rigging scandal involving the London interbank offered rate, or Libor.

headline.main: Banks Face Suits as States Weigh Libor Losses
